conclusion: To solve the problem, analyze the image to understand the layout of the liquid flow and baffles, then predict which container will receive liquid based on its path.

The image depicts a setup involving liquid flow from four sources labeled A, B, C, and D. These sources are situated along a linear path with baffles, directing the liquid into containers E, F, and G. The colors and shapes indicate different paths that the liquid might take after passing through the baffles.
Liquid sources A, B, C, and D are positioned at the top of the image.
Containers E, F, and G are positioned at the bottom of the image.
Stream A strikes the grey slanted barrier and is deflected to the left.
Stream B strikes the grey slanted barrier and is deflected to the right.
Streams C and D drop straight down without encountering any baffles.
Stream A strikes the green slanted baffle and splits into two: one branch hugs the left wall and flows straight down, the other runs along the green baffle and then impacts the pink slanted barrier.
Streams B and C merge and flow together down the black slanted baffle.
Stream D continues to fall straight down without deflection.

premise: Stream A splits into two branches after hitting the green slanted baffle.
conclusion: Most of stream A ends in container E.

premise: Streams B and C merge and flow together down the black slanted baffle.
conclusion: Streams B and C end in container F.

premise: Stream D continues to fall straight down without deflection.
conclusion: Stream D ends in container G.

premise: Analysis of all streams and their paths.
conclusion: Most of stream A ends in container E; streams B and C merge and end in container F; stream D ends in container G.
